description: Numbers in which the number of distinct base 6 digits is 2.
links: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
maple: M:= 6: # get all terms < 6^Msort([seq(seq(seq(seq(add(6^(m-j)*`if`(member(j,S2),d2,d1),j=1..m)  ,S2 = combinat:-powerset({$2..m}) minus {{}}),d2 = {$0..5} minus {d1}), d1 = 1..5), m=2..M)]);# _Robert Israel_, Dec 03 2015
mathematica: fQ[n_] := Length@ Union@ IntegerDigits[n, 6] == 2; Select[Range@117, fQ] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Dec 03 2015 *)
author: _Clark Kimberling_
